error TS2318: Cannot find global type 'RegExp'.
error TS2318: Cannot find global type 'String'.
error TS2552: Cannot find name 'Boolean'. Did you mean 'boolean'?
error TS2552: Cannot find name 'Number'. Did you mean 'number'?
error TS2552: Cannot find name 'Object'. Did you mean 'object'?
callWithSpreadES6.ts(14,14): error TS2488: Type '{}' must have a '[Symbol.iterator]()' method that returns an iterator.
callWithSpreadES6.ts(29,3): error TS2304: Cannot find name 'Function'.
callWithSpreadES6.ts(29,26): error TS2488: Type '[number, number, string]' must have a '[Symbol.iterator]()' method that returns an iterator.


!!! error TS2318: Cannot find global type 'Array'.
!!! error TS2318: Cannot find global type 'Function'.

!!! error TS2552: Cannot find name 'Object'. Did you mean 'object'?
==== callWithSpreadES6.ts (3 errors) ====
    interface X {
        foo(x: number, y: number, ...z: string[]);
    }
    
    function foo(x: number, y: number, ...z: string[]) {
    }
    
    var a: string[];
    var z: number[];
    var obj: X;
    var xa: X[];
    
    foo(1, 2, "abc");
    foo(1, 2, ...a);
                 ~
!!! error TS2488: Type '{}' must have a '[Symbol.iterator]()' method that returns an iterator.
    foo(1, 2, ...a, "abc");
    
    obj.foo(1, 2, "abc");
    obj.foo(1, 2, ...a);
    obj.foo(1, 2, ...a, "abc");
    
    (obj.foo)(1, 2, "abc");
    (obj.foo)(1, 2, ...a);
    (obj.foo)(1, 2, ...a, "abc");
    
    xa[1].foo(1, 2, "abc");
    xa[1].foo(1, 2, ...a);
    xa[1].foo(1, 2, ...a, "abc");
    
    (<Function>xa[1].foo)(...[1, 2, "abc"]);
      ~~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2304: Cannot find name 'Function'.
                             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2488: Type '[number, number, string]' must have a '[Symbol.iterator]()' method that returns an iterator.
    
    class C {
        constructor(x: number, y: number, ...z: string[]) {
            this.foo(x, y);
            this.foo(x, y, ...z);
        }
        foo(x: number, y: number, ...z: string[]) {
        }
    }
    
    class D extends C {
        constructor() {
            super(1, 2);
            super(1, 2, ...a);
        }
        foo() {
            super.foo(1, 2);
            super.foo(1, 2, ...a);
        }
    }
